item.title: Aflac Finds Suspicious Activity on US Network That May Impact Social Security Numbers, Other Data
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Aflac said that it’s in the early stages of a review of the incident, and so far is unable to determine the total number of affected individuals.

The post Aflac Finds Suspicious Activity on US Network That May Impact Social Security Numbers, Other Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: Viasat Hacked by China, Washington Post Cyberattack, Crowhammer
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: China’s Salt Typhoon targeted Viasat, Washington Post emails compromised in hack, Rowhammer attack named Crowhammer.

The post In Other News: Viasat Hacked by China, Washington Post Cyberattack, Crowhammer appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Record-Breaking 7.3 Tbps DDoS Attack Targets Hosting Provider
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Cloudflare has blocked yet another record-breaking DDoS attack, which delivered the equivalent of 9,000 HD movies in just 45 seconds.

The post Record-Breaking 7.3 Tbps DDoS Attack Targets Hosting Provider appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Godfather Android Trojan Creates Sandbox on Infected Devices
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The Godfather Android trojan uses on-device virtualization to hijack legitimate applications and steal users’ funds.

The post Godfather Android Trojan Creates Sandbox on Infected Devices appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Motors Theme Vulnerability Exploited to Hack WordPress Websites
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Threat actors are exploiting a critical-severity vulnerability in Motors theme for WordPress to change arbitrary user passwords.

The post Motors Theme Vulnerability Exploited to Hack WordPress Websites appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: FreeType Zero-Day Found by Meta Exploited in Paragon Spyware Attacks
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
WhatsApp told SecurityWeek that it linked the exploited FreeType vulnerability CVE-2025-27363 to a Paragon exploit.

The post FreeType Zero-Day Found by Meta Exploited in Paragon Spyware Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cloudflare Tunnels Abused in New Malware Campaign
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A threat actor is abusing Cloudflare Tunnels for the delivery of a Python loader as part of a complex infection chain.

The post Cloudflare Tunnels Abused in New Malware Campaign appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 161,000 People Impacted by Krispy Kreme Data Breach
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Krispy Kreme is sharing more information on the data breach resulting from the ransomware attack targeting the company in 2024. 

The post 161,000 People Impacted by Krispy Kreme Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Access Legacy Systems in Oxford City Council Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Personal data of former and current council workers, including election staff, may have been accessed by hackers.

The post Hackers Access Legacy Systems in Oxford City Council Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Predatory Sparrow Burns $90 Million on Iranian Crypto Exchange in Cyber Shadow War
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Israel-linked Predatory Sparrow hackers torched more than $90 million at Iran’s largest cryptobank as Israel-Iran cyberwar escalates.

The post Predatory Sparrow Burns $90 Million on Iranian Crypto Exchange in Cyber Shadow War appeared first on SecurityWeek.
